Burma: Burmese armies withdrawn from Siam and redeployed to the Chinese front. Burmese defenses against the Chinese invasions held. Siam recaptures all of its territories (except Tenasserim) (to 1770)
Chile: Ancud is founded. Chiloé becomes part of the Viceroyalty of Peru.
France: Treaty of Versailles: In order to pay its debts and being no longer able to suppress struggle for independence, the Republic of Genoa ceded Corsica to France. Corsica remained French ever since.
Nepal: Gorkha ruler Prithvi Narayan Shah conquers Kathmandu and lays foundations for unified kingdom.
Philippine: Royal decree banishing the Society of Jesus from Spain and the Spanish dominions reaches Manila
Poland:
Koliyivschyna
Massacre of Uman
Signing of the Bar Confederation
Russia: Repnin Sejm: Delegates of the Sejm adopted a treaty ensuring future Russian influence in Polish internal politics. Polish nobles established the Bar Confederation in order to end Russian influence in their country. Russo-Turkish War (1768–1774): The Ottoman sultan declared war on Russia.
Sweden: December Crisis (1768) fails to increase royal power
